elements.title: Shōjo Club (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the founder of the magazine Shōjo Club (issue pictured) hoped that the publication would instill in its readership the "inner modesty and fortitude of samurai women"?

elements.title: E. J. Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Stanford's E. J. Smith, son of the National Football League's all-time leading rusher, was named a 2022 breakout candidate at his father's position?

elements.title: Ich lobe meinen Gott, der aus der Tiefe mich holt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that members of a 250,000-strong crowd sang the refrain of the Christian hymn "Ich lobe meinen Gott, der aus der Tiefe mich holt" during the 2015 Kirchentag?

elements.title: Judith Schiff (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Judith Schiff, as chief research archivist at the Yale University Library, helped determine that skeletons exposed by a tree uprooted by Hurricane Sandy dated to the 18th century?

elements.title: British Empire seized the disputed territory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that neighboring British Sierra Leone and Liberia disputed their border, and the British Empire seized the disputed territory in 1885?

elements.title: William Heath Byford (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William Heath Byford performed the first ovariotomy in Chicago in 1860?

elements.title: Barclays House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Barclays House in Poole, England, has been sinking since its construction in 1975?

elements.title: Sean Barber (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that getting bitten by an eel led Sean Barber to become an umpire?
